segment.source: Composition visual tree
segment.target: Composition visual tree

segment.source: Composition Visuals make up the visual tree structure which all other features of the composition API use and build on.
segment.target: Composition Visuals make up the visual tree structure which all other features of the composition API use and build on.

segment.source: The API allows developers to define and create one or many visual objects each representing a single node in a visual tree.
segment.target: The API allows developers to define and create one or many visual objects each representing a single node in a visual tree.

segment.source: Composition visual tree
segment.target: Composition visual tree

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Composition Visuals make up the visual tree structure which all other features of the composition API use and build on.
segment.target: Composition Visuals make up the visual tree structure which all other features of the composition API use and build on.

segment.source: The API allows developers to define and create one or many visual objects each representing a single node in a visual tree.
segment.target: The API allows developers to define and create one or many visual objects each representing a single node in a visual tree.

segment.source: Visuals
segment.target: Visuals

segment.source: There are three visual types that make up the visual tree structure plus a base brush class with multiple subclasses that affect the content of a visual:
segment.target: There are three visual types that make up the visual tree structure plus a base brush class with multiple subclasses that affect the content of a visual:

segment.source: Visual – base object, the majority of the properties are here, and inherited by the other Visual objects.
segment.target: Visual – base object, the majority of the properties are here, and inherited by the other Visual objects.

segment.source: ContainerVisual – derives from Visual, and adds the ability to create children.
segment.target: ContainerVisual – derives from Visual, and adds the ability to create children.

segment.source: SpriteVisual – Derives from ContainerVisual and adds the ability to associate a brush so that the Visual can render pixels including images, effects or a solid color.
segment.target: SpriteVisual – Derives from ContainerVisual and adds the ability to associate a brush so that the Visual can render pixels including images, effects or a solid color.

segment.source: CompositionBrush – Allows the application of an effect on the content of a Visual.
segment.target: CompositionBrush – Allows the application of an effect on the content of a Visual.

segment.source: There are a number of subclasses of CompositionBrush.
segment.target: There are a number of subclasses of CompositionBrush.

segment.source: The CompositionVisual Sample
segment.target: The CompositionVisual Sample

segment.source: In the sample there are a number of solid color squares that can be clicked on and dragged about the screen.
segment.target: In the sample there are a number of solid color squares that can be clicked on and dragged about the screen.

segment.source: When a square is clicked on, it will come to the front, rotate 45 degrees, and become opaque when dragged about.
segment.target: When a square is clicked on, it will come to the front, rotate 45 degrees, and become opaque when dragged about.

segment.source: This shows a number of basic concepts for working with the API including:
segment.target: This shows a number of basic concepts for working with the API including:

segment.source: Creating a compositor
segment.target: Creating a compositor

segment.source: Creating a SpriteVisual with a ColorBrush
segment.target: Creating a SpriteVisual with a ColorBrush

segment.source: Clipping a Visual
segment.target: Clipping a Visual

segment.source: Rotating a Visual
segment.target: Rotating a Visual

segment.source: Setting Opacity
segment.target: Setting Opacity

segment.source: Changing the Visual’s position in the collection.
segment.target: Changing the Visual’s position in the collection.

segment.source: In the sample there are also three different Visuals at work:
segment.target: In the sample there are also three different Visuals at work:

segment.source: Visual – base object, the majority of the properties are here, and inherited by the other Visual objects.
segment.target: Visual – base object, the majority of the properties are here, and inherited by the other Visual objects.

segment.source: ContainerVisual – derives from Visual, and adds the ability to create children.
segment.target: ContainerVisual – derives from Visual, and adds the ability to create children.

segment.source: SpriteVisual – Derives from Visual and adds the ability to associate a brush so that the Visual can render pixels including images, effects or a solid color.
segment.target: SpriteVisual – Derives from Visual and adds the ability to associate a brush so that the Visual can render pixels including images, effects or a solid color.

segment.source: While this sample doesn’t cover concepts like Animations or more complex effects, it contains the building blocks that all of those systems use.
segment.target: While this sample doesn’t cover concepts like Animations or more complex effects, it contains the building blocks that all of those systems use.

segment.source: Creating a Compositor
segment.target: Creating a Compositor

segment.source: Creating a Compositor and storing it for use as a factory in a variable is a simple task.
segment.target: Creating a Compositor and storing it for use as a factory in a variable is a simple task.

segment.source: The following snippet shows creating a new Compositor:
segment.target: The following snippet shows creating a new Compositor:

segment.source: Creating a SpriteVisual and ColorBrush
segment.target: Creating a SpriteVisual and ColorBrush

segment.source: Using the Compositor it's easy to create objects whenever you need them, such as a SpriteVisual and a CompositionColorBrush:
segment.target: Using the Compositor it's easy to create objects whenever you need them, such as a SpriteVisual and a CompositionColorBrush:

segment.source: While this is only a few lines of code it demonstrates a powerful concept, SpriteVisual objects are the heart of the effects system.
segment.target: While this is only a few lines of code it demonstrates a powerful concept, SpriteVisual objects are the heart of the effects system.

segment.source: The SpriteVisual allows for great flexibility and interplay in color, image and effect creation.
segment.target: The SpriteVisual allows for great flexibility and interplay in color, image and effect creation.

segment.source: The SpriteVisual is a single visual type that can fill a 2D rectangle with a brush, in this case a solid color.
segment.target: The SpriteVisual is a single visual type that can fill a 2D rectangle with a brush, in this case a solid color.

segment.source: Clipping a Visual
segment.target: Clipping a Visual

segment.source: The Compositor can also be used to create clips to a Visual.
segment.target: The Compositor can also be used to create clips to a Visual.

segment.source: Below is an example from the sample of using the InsetClip to trim each side of the visual:
segment.target: Below is an example from the sample of using the InsetClip to trim each side of the visual:

segment.source: Note: Like other objects in the API InsetClip can have animations applied to its properties.
segment.target: Note: Like other objects in the API InsetClip can have animations applied to its properties.

segment.source: Rotating a Clip
segment.target: Rotating a Clip

segment.source: A Visual can be transformed with a rotation.
segment.target: A Visual can be transformed with a rotation.

segment.source: Note that RotationAngle supports both radians and degrees.
segment.target: Note that RotationAngle supports both radians and degrees.

segment.source: It defaults to radians, but it’s easy to specify degrees as shown in the following snippet:
segment.target: It defaults to radians, but it’s easy to specify degrees as shown in the following snippet:

segment.source: Rotation is just one example of a set of transform components provided by the API to make these tasks easier.
segment.target: Rotation is just one example of a set of transform components provided by the API to make these tasks easier.

segment.source: Others include Offset, Scale, Orientation, RotationAxis and a 4x4 TransformMatrix.
segment.target: Others include Offset, Scale, Orientation, RotationAxis and a 4x4 TransformMatrix.

segment.source: Setting Opacity
segment.target: Setting Opacity

segment.source: Setting the opacity of a visual is a simple operation using a float value.
segment.target: Setting the opacity of a visual is a simple operation using a float value.

segment.source: For example, in the sample all the squares start at .8 opacity:
segment.target: For example, in the sample all the squares start at .8 opacity:

segment.source: Like rotation, the Opacity property can be animated.
segment.target: Like rotation, the Opacity property can be animated.

segment.source: Changing the Visual's position in the collection
segment.target: Changing the Visual's position in the collection

segment.source: The Composition API allows for a Visual's position in a VisualCollection to be changed in a number of ways, it can be placed above another Visual with InsertAbove, placed below with InsertBelow, move to the top with InsertAtTop or the bottom with InsertAtBottom.
segment.target: The Composition API allows for a Visual's position in a VisualCollection to be changed in a number of ways, it can be placed above another Visual with InsertAbove, placed below with InsertBelow, move to the top with InsertAtTop or the bottom with InsertAtBottom.

segment.source: In the sample a Visual that has been clicked on is sorted to the top:
segment.target: In the sample a Visual that has been clicked on is sorted to the top:

segment.source: Full Example
segment.target: Full Example

segment.source: In the full sample, all of the concepts above are used together to construct and walk a simple tree of Visual objects to change opacity without using XAML, WWA, or DirectX.
segment.target: In the full sample, all of the concepts above are used together to construct and walk a simple tree of Visual objects to change opacity without using XAML, WWA, or DirectX.

segment.source: This sample shows how child Visual objects are created and added and how properties are changed.
segment.target: This sample shows how child Visual objects are created and added and how properties are changed.
